channel.title: briefUpdatesHealthOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesHealthOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Walmart recalls frozen shrimp over potential radioactive contamination
item.description: The risk from the recalled shrimp is "quite low," said Donald Schaffner, a food safety expert at Rutgers University. Cesium-137 is a byproduct of nucl...

item.title: Ticks are migrating, but scant surveillance may leave doctors in the dark on patient treatment
item.description: Health departments struggle to adequately survey for ticks to warn doctors about new species and the diseases they carry.

item.title: These brain implants speak your mind — even when you don't want to
item.description: Brain-implanted devices that allow paralyzed people to speak can also decode words they imagine, but don't intend to share.

item.title: A hurricane's effects on victims' health last for years after the storm, study finds
item.description: A new study shows that the effects hurricanes have on people's health can last for years after a storm passes.

item.title: Optum Rx Invokes Open Meetings Law To Fight Kentucky Counties on Opioid Suits

item.title: After the CDC shooting, federal workers demand more protections from RFK Jr.

item.title: Ingrid Lindberg, Sobrynth

item.title: Kennedy’s Anti-Vaccine Strategy Risks Forcing Shots Off Market, Manufacturers Warn
item.description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is targeting the government’s Vaccine Injury Compensation Program, without which manufacture...

item.title: Planned Parenthood Bets on Redistricting To Push Back Against GOP Funding Cuts

item.title: Guns, Race, and Profit: The Pain of America’s Other Epidemic
item.description: Firearm violence is killing Americans at the scale of a public health epidemic. The suffering is concentrated in Black neighborhoods damaged by segreg...

item.title: Listen to the Latest ‘KFF Health News Minute’
item.description: The "KFF Health News Minute” brings original health care and health policy reporting from our newsroom to the airwaves each week.
